title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 12.1 - Spring creek in caledonia state fish hatchery
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 12.1 - Spring creek in caledonia state fish hatchery

State Regulations
(a) The taking of all species of fish in

Spring Creek on property of the Caledonia State Fish Hatchery, upstream from
the hatchery, in the Town of Caledonia in Livingston County shall be subject to
the following regulations: (1)

No person shall
enter the fishing area except through the main entrance of the Caledonia State

Fish Hatchery. (2)

No person shall
take fish except from the walk provided along the east bank of the stream
beginning at a point 200 feet above the hatchery dam and extending upstream to
a sign designating the end of the fishing area. (3)

No person shall wade in the stream or
fish from a boat, canoe or raft. (4)

No person shall cut, damage or destroy
any live vegetation along the banks of the stream or any aquatic vegetation
growing in the stream, nor shall any person build fires in the fishing
area. (b) The taking of
all species of fish in Spring Creek on property of the Caledonia State Fish

Hatchery, downstream from the railroad trestle for a distance of 900 feet in
the Town of Wheatland, Monroe County, shall be subject to the following: (1)

No person shall enter this fishing area
through the main entrance of the Caledonia State Fish Hatchery. (2)

No person shall fish from a boat, canoe
or raft. (3)

No person shall cut, damage or destroy any live vegetation along the banks of the stream or any
aquatic vegetation growing in the stream, nor shall any person build fires in
the fishing area. Notes

12.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
